alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 06 at 2:39PM MST until November 07 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TUESDAY BETWEEN 11 AM MST AND 5 PM MST ACROSS PORTIONS OF WESTERN AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES... .An approaching upper level trough will bring strong winds and reinforcing dry air over portions of eastern and far western New Mexico Tuesday. Above average temperatures will persist and poor to fair overnight humidity recovery tonight will lead to low double digit values by the afternoon, with localized single digits possible. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 5 PM MST TUESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 5 PM MST Tuesday. * AREA AND TIMING...West Central Mountains (Zone 105), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Central Highlands (Zone 125), and East Central Plains (Zone 126) between 11 AM and 5 PM Tuesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...9 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; West Central Mountains
